Sentencas: The anodic oxidation reactions of solid oxide fuel cells are studied by density functional theory method under different oxygen coverage on the Ni(1 1 1) surface.
Titulo: First-principles study of oxygen coverage effect on hydrogen oxidation on Ni(111) surface

Sentencas: Co-adsorbed atoms can change the binding energy of adsorbed species, and then affect the reaction barriers.
Titulo: First-principles study of oxygen coverage effect on hydrogen oxidation on Ni(111) surface

Sentencas: We analyze the detailed structures and atomic charges to explain the mechanism of oxygen coverage effect.
Titulo: First-principles study of oxygen coverage effect on hydrogen oxidation on Ni(111) surface

Sentencas: Our results indicate that higher oxygen coverage (in the range between 0 and 219) leads to lower oxidation reaction barriers.
Titulo: First-principles study of oxygen coverage effect on hydrogen oxidation on Ni(111) surface

Sentencas: The main reason of the effect is the charge transfer between species and Ni surface was changed by the electron acceptor of co-adsorbed oxygen atoms.
Titulo: First-principles study of oxygen coverage effect on hydrogen oxidation on Ni(111) surface
